ai-iti47:1.1_0: For this was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
ai-iti47:2.1_0: “Meditate wakeful, mendicants, mindful and aware, joyful and clear, and at times discern the skillful qualities in that state.
ai-iti47:2.2_0: A mendicant who meditates in this way can expect one of two results:
ai-iti47:2.3_0: enlightenment in the present life, or if there’s something left over, non-return.”
ai-iti47:4.1_0: Those who are wakeful, mindful and aware,
ai-iti47:4.2_0: immersed in samādhi, joyful and clear,
ai-iti47:4.3_0: at times rightly investigating the Dhamma:
ai-iti47:5.1_0: That’s why you should cultivate wakefulness.
ai-iti47:5.2_0: A keen and alert mendicant, possessing absorption,
ai-iti47:5.4_0: would realize supreme awakening in this very life.”
ai-iti47:6.1_0: That is what the Buddha has heard.
